properties.Title: Civil Emergency, Update From Sk Provincial Emergency Communications Centre
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
Expires: 2021-02-03T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-01-20T12:04:29-06:00, FED4BBB6-6DC4-0667-3BAE-A11E3D50799A
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight into Thursday morning. Lake enhanced snow will continue over the northern shore of Lake Superior tonight into tomorrow morning with total snowfall amounts of 10 - 15 cm possible. This snow combined with winds gusting up to 60 km/h could result in significantly reduced visibilities in snow and blowing snow. Difficult winter travel conditions are expected, particularly along Highway 17. Slow down and use caution while driving. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T17:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T02:01:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0400721515.2021
Area: White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Hamlet Of Livelong
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Hamlet of Livelong. This advisory is for the entire community of Livelong and for any individuals who may access water the Hamlet of Livelong water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2021-01-29T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-01-20T11:33:09-06:00, C5265E0E-A280-D098-C1CC-7A781FF85B94
Area: Hamlet of Livelong
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected beginning early Thursday morning. Conditions will improve later on in the day. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T12:49:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-20T20:50:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3180762488.2021
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake, Quaqtaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Resort Village Of Manitou Beach
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Resort Village of Manitou Beach. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water the the Resort Village of Manitou Beach water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2021-01-25T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-01-20T08:47:39-06:00, F56ADA70-D831-8A87-4B20-577623FD60BA
Area: The Resort Village of Manitou Beach
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Easterly winds with gusts up to 90 km/h are expected Thursday afternoon. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T12:36:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-20T20:37:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0510952792.2021
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: The conditions prompting this advisory have improved. Local blowing snow may persist throughout the day. ###
Expires: 2021-01-21T09:33:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T08:34:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1263061717.2021
Area: Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Nipigon - Rossport
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential winter storm beginning Thursday evening. Total estimated snowfall: likely exceeding 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northerly near 70 km/h. Locations: the northeast coast from Clarenville to Green Bay - White Bay, excluding the Bonavista peninsula. Time span: Thursday evening into Friday afternoon. Remarks: A developing storm south of Nova Scotia will track east of Newfoundland Thursday and Friday. Snow is expected to spread across the northeast coast Thursday evening, accompanied by strong winds and areas of blowing snow. Conditions will improve by Friday afternoon. There is still uncertainty regarding the track of this storm, which will have a significant impact on snowfall amounts. Should the storm pass further east, snowfall amounts will be much less, while if it tracks closer to the island, higher accumulations will be expected. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-21T18:05:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T02:06:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2088872806.2021
Area: Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A very cold air mass will generate extreme wind chill values of minus 38 overnight tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T18:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T03:35:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0961655291.2021
Area: Manic-5 area, Manic-3 area, Chutes-des-Passes - Pipmuacan Reservoir area, Labrieville area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for significant snowfall and blowing snow beginning Thursday night. Locations: the Great Northern Peninsula. Time span: Overnight Thursday night through the weekend. Remarks: A developing storm may affect the Great Northern Peninsula beginning Thursday night. At this time, uncertainty in the track of the system means it is too early to provide specific details, but the potential exists for a prolonged period of strong winds accompanied by significant amounts of snow that may last through the weekend. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-21T18:07:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T02:08:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0636832240.2021
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected by Thursday afternoon. Lake enhanced snow will continue tonight along the northern and eastern shores of Lake Superior. This snow combined with winds gusting up 70 km/h could result in blowing snow and considerably reduced visibilities. Travel may become particularly hazardous along Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Batchawana Bay. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T19:52:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T03:53:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3180715045.2021
Area: Marathon - Schreiber, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park, Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 35 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 80 km/h. Locations: Avalon and Bonavista Peninsulas. Time span: near noon Thursday until early Friday morning. Remarks: Snow at times heavy will begin over the southern Avalon Peninsula near noon Thursday then elsewhere in the afternoon or evening. Strong northeasterly winds will accompany the snow. Conditions are expected to improve Thursday night over the southern Avalon and elsewhere by Friday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-21T18:02:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T02:03:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1804191652.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Bonavista Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 90 km/h continue to affect parts of southern Manitoba. Winds will gradually begin to taper off this afternoon and through the evening hours. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T08:59:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-20T19:41:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3903833596.2021

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for Thursday morning and early afternoon. Lake enhanced snow could result in accumulations of 5 to 10 cm tomorrow morning into the early afternoon with heavy snow possible at times. The snow combined with northwest winds possibly gusting up to 60 km/h could result in reduced visibilities in blowing snow. Difficult winter travel conditions are expected, particularly along Highway 17. Slow down and use caution while driving. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T19:21:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T03:50:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1705225871.2021
Area: Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Further snowfall: 10 to 15 cm with locally higher amounts possible. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h or higher. Locations: northern Labrador. Time span: continuing until Thursday morning. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will be accompanied by very strong northwesterly winds and cold temperatures to bring near-zero visibilities in blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve overnight tonight and into Thursday morning as winds begin to ease and snow tapers off. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-21T13:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T02:09:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0292801753.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
